result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio C. McBride was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:45 a.m.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  6/3/22, 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Further proceedings scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:14 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonio C. McBride in court.  Attorney Luke Harrison in court for Antonio C. McBride. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-28-22 at 11:00 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant in person, having appeared voluntarily on warrant. The matter is continued for initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 3. Previously furnished recognizance bond is continued by the court with all prior conditions. 
Minutes.
Non-appearance by defendant for initial appearance.  Warrant issued on State's motion.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping and possess THC.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-14-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
